data.title: Best Fish Tacos around!
data.text:
We've been here quite a few times and have always had a great time. Live bands, great food, and awesome atmosphere.
The fish tacos are a don't miss! They are the best I've had anywhere.

data.title: Excellent food and drinks and good dancing music on weekends.
data.text: We have been going here for years..  We have never had a bad time or meal here. We have been to a Wedding reception, Retirement party, Celebration of life, and many Birthday parties here including my own.  They have great music here on the weekends and a lot of my friends come here to dance.  We enjoy all of the wait staff here they all do a great job.

data.title: Give it a try!
data.text: First time visiting this place.  Have passed it many times, as the local Wednesday night car shows are located in front of this restaurant during the summer months, and came with a group of 15 to celebrate a friends birthday.  We called ahead of time for a reservation for indoors.  Upon arrival there was a wedding reception going on in the outside patio area.  People seemed to be having a great time. We sat down and waited and waited and waited for our server to order our drinks.  They have a very large bar area, with a good selection of local and craft beers as well as a full bar for mixed drinks as well.  We then got to wait and wait for her to deliver the drinks.  This was the most disappointing thing about our visit.  Seemed mgmt did not schedule enough servers to work the wedding AND take care of other people inside.....BAD.  We ordered lots of different things and everyone seemed happy with the food.  I would give it another try but they should of been better prepared to handle ALL their clients. Wanted to rate it 3 1/2 stars.

data.title: Good for large groups
data.text: The food is always decent at "downtown".  I have been there for several large group gatherings, such as holiday parties, retirements, etc.  My only concern is that sometimes you have to look for a wait-person to get what you need.

data.title: " Happy Hour Food , Drinks, and Entertainment, was Nice "
data.text: I went to the Downtown Cafe in El Cajon, CA. for their Happy Hour food and drinks, and their outside music entertainment on Sunday. Maritza my server was very nice as she had a smiling face as she took care of my orders. Scott the Bartender made a very good "Long Island Ice Tea drink, as I enjoyed the music from several live band groups in their outdoor seating area. I had the BBQ Chicken Flat Bread Pizza, which was very good and was nice and crispy, just the way I like it. For dessert I had a delicious piece of Carrot Cake. Good food, Good drinks, and Good entertainment, for a Good Sunday kick back Day.

data.title: HORRIBLE
data.text: Run away poor quality food. rude waitress. 45mims wait for nachos. even food on the floor not cleaned after 30mins. UNACCEPTABLE worst place i have never been in san diego...

data.title: Where WASPy Over 50's Go to Shake Their Groove-Thang on the Weekend
data.text:
Yes, the food is ok.  I've had a variety of items here every time I've stopped in.  It's ok food (sometimes good), the service is nice enough, though at times they forget about you if you're seated out on the patio area near the street.... There's a great selection of craft beers and if you've ever wanted to try some high-end hard ciders, this place has them, frequently.... But what REALLY amazes me is the consistency of the patrons.

In the summer, El Cajon hosts a free concert-in-the-park which is fun, lasts into the evening, and is right across the street from the Downtown Bar and Grill.  So, I walked past this place to get to my car DOZENS of times last summer, and stopped in once or twice after a concert with my adult children.  While the concert in the park was a diverse mix of people, the patrons at the Downtown had an amazing amount of homogeny:  every single person there was a WASPy over-50-something, attempting to "get down" to the Beach Boys or some ZZ Top.  It was like the Brigantine, only for folks who were a little older, a lot less hip, and on budgets.  

Everyone needs a place where they feel comfortable....  so, if "a little older, a lot less hip, and on a budget" sounds like something you're into, go for it.

data.title: " Our Lunch was Awesome ! "
data.text: Two friends and I went to the Downtown Cafe at 182 E. Main Street in El Cajon this week, and enjoyed a great Lunch experience. Tasha our server was very nice and did a good job taking care of our needs for lunch. Both of my friends had Taco plates. One  had  the Grilled Mahi Tacos with Grilled Mahi, Salsa Fresca, Cabbage, Avocado, Black Beans, and Chips. My other friend had the Carnita Tacos with Pork, Salsa Fresca, Lettuce, Black Beans, Cheese and Chips.  Both Taco plates looked and tasted delicious ! For my lunch I had the Louisiana Wrap with Louisiana Chicken, Romaine, Tomato, Ranch Coleslaw, and Chips. The chicken was so tender and tasty. The Downtown Cafe has 34 beers on Tap, and has a huge Bar area with a wide range of Alcohol drinks to chose from. Everyone was telling us to come back for their happy hour, which is supposed to be very good. I will definitely go back to the Downtown Cafe Again !

data.title: Good fresh food and well-stocked bar!
data.text:
If you like "munchie" food, then this is the place to go.  Happy Hour has some superb prices and drink specials.  I tried a whiskey based drink that was simply excellent--it was refreshing and different.  They have a wide assortment of craft beer, and of course, domestic.  I have been here multiple times over the years and have always enjoyed the menu.  At times, they have live music available as well which is always quite good. I took a friend there who is from Germany & she enjoyed the ambience plus the beer selection--German love their beer!  ;) 
You will enjoy your time there!

data.title: Sunday Blues Jam
data.text:
The Sunday   Patio Blues Jam  is a high point not to be missed. Some of the counties best musicians come out to play on the Downtown Cafe stage. 
Now, about the food ..... come with an appetite because the yummy fare is served in generous portions. From the appetizers to the decadent desserts you won't be disappointed ! Again, don't miss out on this wonderful cafe. :-)

data.title: Wedding Reception
data.text: Great outdoor patio atmosphere.  Had the fish tacos that were great.  No complaints from our table about the food.  Several had the steak sandwich and service was good.  We had Tasha and her service was good.  Very busy Saturday night but the weather was great.  Country bad was ok.  Seems there were regulars there for the band.

data.title: Cheap Eats!
data.text: We like to eat cheap, so we eat in the bar at happy hour. Hubby likes the three dollar cheeseburger. I have two pork tacos for three dollars. With drinks, under ten dollars!

data.title: Great spot for summer entertainment & great service
data.text: Downtown is run by some great people, and the wait staff is among the best around. The patio area outside is a perfect spot for a spring or summer evening, especially when there is entertainment playing.

data.title: Great food and music!
data.text: Downtown Cafe has new beers on tap daily; there is a good variety on the menu and on weekends great music out on the patio. Get there early as it can fill up on a Saturday night. I've also been there for a few weddings and they were always done nicely.

data.title: Why no Gluten Free
data.text: I ordered salmon with mashed potatoes and declared that I must have gluten free food.  Salad came with croutons; mashed potatoes came with brown gravy.  Waiter said he had to do some research on what gluten free means.  How a fairly large restaurant can ignore a whole group of diners by not even understanding what the term GF means in 2015 is ridiculous.  The restaurant was crowded, there is a band on Friday nights, and this could be a great place to dine if a little more thought went into accomodating customers with special needs.

data.title: FABULOUS
data.text: It's a mystery to me why this place wasn't overflowing with customers. $3 Margaritas that skimped on nothing, (they even salted the rim to my satisfaction)and a cheeseburger on the happy hour bar menu ( til 6)that I photographed because of its unbelievable beauty that I knew would most likely not be believed. And here's another fabulous reason why I'll be going back - free WiFi.

data.title: dinner and  music
data.text: The staff is soo nice.  and  the food YUMMY .   the music was  great. I like that its outdoors and if we wanted to bring the kids we can  do  so ..

data.title: Decent Eatery
data.text: Wife and I have eaten here a number of times and I'm impressed they've been in business for a number of years. It's a decent restaurant. Nothing spectacular and nothing on their menu that lights up the taste buds, but you can arrive hungry and find something that will appeal. It's a convenient spot for those who enjoy the Classic Car Shows in the Downtown area on Wednesday evenings throughout the summer.

data.title: Definitely coming back
data.text: The Downtown Cafe Bar & Grill is not fancy, but it is very quaint, historic, with great food, reasonably priced.  You can choose to dine inside or out - it was a hot day so we chose inside.  The AC was struggling to keep up, but it was still comfortable.  Our booth was in the bar area, which was great.  Our waitress was right on time and attentive without being a problem.  I asked her for a recommendation (something that would get me to come back) and she recommended the shrimp & chicken quesadilla.  I loved it.  They also have an extensive selection of draft beers, including many of San Diego's famous local brews in addition to Guiness and other favorites.  We will definitely come back here - next time on a cooler day when we can enjoy the extensive patio.

data.title: Depends on your perspective
data.text: I went there with a group of 4 on a weekday in March, so it was not busy at all. They have a HUGE outdoor patio with plenty of covered dining spots and so we chose a spot outside, but it felt a bit warm under the canopy. We probably should have opted to go inside, but that's neither here nor there. Our waitress was prompt and agreeable. The menu is varied and has a variety of Mexican dishes and also their "specialty" is an assortment of flatbread choices. I have a very sensitive palate (I'm not being uppity - I just really have a hard time with spicy food), so I have to be careful about what I order. I noticed some of their items were "Cajun" or "Louisiana this or that", so I asked if the "crabcake salad" was spicy. She said she didn't know, but would ask. I said if it wasn't, I would get that. My husband ordered a club sandwich, a third person ordered a burger, and a fourth ordered a flatbread with pork carnitas w/mango salsa. These dishes were in the $12-$14 range except for the burger which was around $9. When the food came, my "salad" consisted of greens, several slices of avocado, a sliced tomato and 2 small crab cakes. The crab cakes were very spicy (IMO). The waitress did not come back to ask about it until AFTER everyone had eaten, but I did eat them because I wouldn't have wanted to hold things up by sending them back. I just wish the chef had said he uses a lot of paprika and black pepper in the first place. My friend with the flatbread gave me a bite of hers. That was REALLY spicy! She didn't mind. It burned my mouth. So, it all depends on what a person likes. I would have a hard time going there again because of this, but they would go there again in a heartbeat. She loved the flatbread. I thought it was kind of chewy and the pork was rubbery, but it was cold by the time I tasted it. My husband's club sandwich was okay, but then a club is boring to begin with. He didn't like the honey mustard dressing on his side salad. So, it just depends on your own individual taste, I think. Downtown El Cajon is an interesting place. We're glad we checked it out and the restaurant itself seemed very nice.
